New Records: Sybrand Engelbrecht and Logan van Beek added 130 runs for the seventh wicket, which was a Cricket World Cup record for that wicket.
Key Match Events: Sadeera Samarawickrama scored an unbeaten 91* to guide Sri Lanka's chase.
Pathum Nissanka hit a brisk 54 to keep Sri Lanka in the chase.
Kasun Rajitha took 4 wickets for 50 runs, including early breakthroughs.
Dilshan Madushanka took 4 wickets for 49 runs, including crucial middle-order wickets.
Aryan Dutt took two quick wickets in the first Powerplay to trouble Sri Lanka.
Sybrand Engelbrecht scored 70 and Logan van Beek scored 59 to help Netherlands reach a competitive total.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka made two changes to their XI, bringing in Dushan Hemantha and Asitha Fernando.
Netherlands were unchanged from the side that defeated South Africa.
Sri Lanka had an unbeaten run through the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup Qualifier, including two wins over Netherlands.
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka garnered their first ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023 win in Lucknow.
Digital Daily with former Sri Lanka all-rounder Russell Arnold and ICC Digital Insider Ridhima Pathak discussed Sri Lanka's five-wicket victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka's spinners controlled the middle overs, with Maheesh Theekshana claiming the key wicket of Netherlands skipper Scott Edwards.
Sri Lanka quicks Rajitha and Madushanka moved the ball through the air effectively at BRSABVE Cricket Stadium.
